tool.name: Scanpy BBKNN
tool.command: #if $batch_key ln -s '${input_obj_file}' input.h5 && PYTHONIOENCODING=utf-8 scanpy-integrate bbknn --batch-key '${batch_key}' #if $settings.default == "false" #if $settings.use_rep --use-rep '${settings.use_rep}' #end if #if $settings.key_added --key-added '${settings.key_added}' #end if #if $settings.n_pcs --n-pcs '${settings.n_pcs}' #end if #if not $settings.approx ${settings.approx} #end if #if $settings.metric --metric '${settings.metric}' #end if #if $settings.neighbors_within_batch --neighbors-within-batch '${settings.neighbors_within_batch}' #end if #if $settings.trim --trim '${settings.trim}' #end if #if $settings.n_trees --n-trees '${settings.n_trees}' #end if #if not $settings.use_faiss ${settings.use_faiss} #end if #if $settings.set_op_mix_ratio --set-op-mix-ratio '${settings.set_op_mix_ratio}' #end if #if $settings.local_connectivity --local-connectivity '${settings.local_connectivity}' #end if #end if @INPUT_OPTS@ @OUTPUT_OPTS@ #else echo "No batch variables passed, simply passing original input as output unchanged." && cp '${input_obj_file}' output.h5 #end if

param.name: batch_key
param.label: The name of the column in adata.obs that differentiates among experiments/batches.

param.name: use_rep
param.label: The dimensionality reduction in .obsm to use for neighbour detection.

param.name: key_added
param.label: Key under which to add the computed results.
param.help: If not specified, the neighbors data is stored in .uns[‘neighbors’], distances and connectivities are stored in .obsp[‘distances’] and .obsp[‘connectivities’] respectively. If specified, the neighbors data is added to .uns[key_added], distances are stored in .obsp[key_added+’_distances’] and connectivities in .obsp[key_added+’_connectivities’].

param.name: approx
param.label: Use annoy’s approximate neighbour finding?
param.help: This results in a quicker run time for large datasets while also potentially increasing the degree of batch correction.

param.name: neighbors_within_batch
param.label: How many top neighbours to report for each batch
param.help: Total number of neighbours will be this number times the number of batches.

param.name: trim
param.label: Trim the neighbours of each cell to these many top connectivities.
param.help: May help with population independence and improve the tidiness of clustering. The lower the value the more independent the individual populations, at the cost of more conserved batch effect. If not set, sets the parameter value automatically to 10 times the total number of neighbours for each cell. Set to 0 to skip.

param.name: n_trees
param.label: The number of trees to construct in the annoy forest.
param.help: More trees give higher precision when querying, at the cost of increased run time and resource intensity.

param.name: use_faiss
param.label: Use the faiss package to compute nearest neighbours if installed
param.help: If approx=False and the metric is 'euclidean' use the faiss package to compute nearest neighbours if installed. This improves performance at a minor cost to numerical precision as faiss operates on float32.

param.name: set_op_mix_ratio
param.label: UMAP connectivity computation parameter
param.help: Float between 0 and 1, controlling the blend between a connectivity matrix formed exclusively from mutual nearest neighbour pairs (0) and a union of all observed neighbour relationships with the mutual pairs emphasised (1).

param.name: local_connectivity
param.label: UMAP connectivity computation parameter, how many nearest neighbors of each cell are assumed to be fully connected (and given a connectivity value of 1).
